poem:
Title: "The Dwindling Dens of Discretion"

A stealthy swell brims up and pleads travail,
In Hertfordshire's greenery, where men, masked in woe.
Public corners scarce, they weave no-tales and pale,
Golden rivulets trill, yet Dacorum cries 'No'.

Three in four lament, scarce ceramic thrones — 
A Royal survey solemnly intones.
At nature's beckon, who will atone?
The Britons sigh, 'Fewer outings we'll condone.'
